text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to detail who has standing to file for guardianship up to the fourth degree of kinship (parents, siblings, children, grandparents, uncles/aunts, nephews/nieces, first cousins, or great-grandparents). The candidate answer mentions that the interested party (usually a relative) files the petition (Section 2.2, Step a) and later notes that the petitioner is often a family member (Section 3, Document 3), but it never explicitly lists the legally recognized degrees of kinship (first, second, third, or fourth degree relatives) who are entitled to file the petition as required by the criterion.", "criterion_id": "6b32e63e-2504-49aa-b218-0d11c7e8d24e"}
